availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Hill (Jefferson County, KY, flour dealer)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, grocer and flour dealer. Native of Germany. Married to Christianna Colbenbock Hill in Jefferson County on November 27, 1843. Father of Caroline Hill, Elizabeth Hill, John Hill, George Hill, and Mary A. Hill. Grocer in Louisville in 1860. Signed a petition as a flour dealer in May 1861 to appoint W. G. Timberlake as flour inspector.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 7, pp. 417-18.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000817885, p. 86.
KYR-0001-017-0163.
